The incubation period for RRV is usually 7 to 9 days, with a range of 3 to 21 days.
1 Acute disease typically involves polyarthralgia or polyarthritis (80%–100% of patients), fever (20%–60%), rash (40%–60%, usually maculopapular), and/or myalgia (40%–80%). 1, 2, 4 The joints most commonly affected are multiple peripheral small joints and the knees, usually with a symmetric pattern ( Table 36.5.1 ). Effusions are often present but are usually small.
2 Other symptoms include fatigue (>50%), headache, photophobia, and lymphadenopathy. 1, 2, 4 RRV encephalitis cases have been reported; however, causal links to the virus are unsupported.
